title: A solution to The Onion problem of J. Kenji Lopez-Alt (2021)
dot: digraph onion_problem{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box, style="rounded,filled", fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10, fillcolor="#f0f0f0", color="#888888"]; start[label="Interest in onion cutting (variance of slice volumes)" shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#f5f5f5"];kenji[label="Chef Kenji's claim: Cut towards 60% of the radius" shape=box, fillcolor="#f0f0f0"]; mathematician[label="Mathematician's approach: Radial cut depth depends on layers" shape=box, fillcolor="#f0f0f0"]; insight[label="Key insight: Treat onion as infinite layers, use calculus" shape=box, fillcolor="#f0f0f0"];jacobian[label="Jacobian transformation (polar coordinates)" shape=box, fillcolor="#f0f0f0"];coordinate_system[label="New coordinate system: Cut towards point below center" shape=box, fillcolor="#f0f0f0"];variance[label="Calculate variance of cut volumes and minimize" shape=box, fillcolor="#f0f0f0"];onion_constant[label="Onion constant found: 0.5573066..." shape=box, fillcolor="#f0f0f0"]; conclusion[label="Conclusion: Radial cut depth for most even slices" shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#f5f5f5"];start->kenji;kenji->mathematician;mathematician->insight;insight->jacobian;jacobian->coordinate_system;coordinate_system->variance;variance->onion_constant;onion_constant->conclusion;edge[dir=none];conclusion->"True onion constant = 0.5573066..."[label="Numerically minimized variance"];}
